title: Software Engineer
description:

**Nice To Have**

**Title:** 
**Data Engineer**
**Overview**
 A Data Engineer plays a crucial role in designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that powers our data\\-driven decisions. Youâ€™ll be at the heart of our data ecosystem, ensuring data is reliably collected, stored, and processed to provide clean, accessible data for our analytics and business intelligence teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design \\& Develop Data Pipelines: Assist in building, maintaining, and optimizing scalable ETL/ELT data pipelines to ingest and transform large datasets from diverse sources, including APIs, databases, and third\\-party systems.
* Data Modeling \\& Warehousing: Support the development of robust data models and schemas in both relational and cloud\\-native data warehouses (e.g., Google BigQuery).
* Ensure Data Integrity: Monitor, troubleshoot, and improve the performance and reliability of data pipelines, ensuring data quality, consistency, and accuracy.
* Data Source Integration: Work with various data formats and sources, including structured, semi\\-structured, and streaming data.
* Data Governance \\& Security: Collaborate with senior engineers to enforce data governance, quality, and security standards across the organization.
* Code \\& Automation: Write clean, efficient, and well\\-documented code (SQL, Python) for data engineering tasks. Utilize Git and CI/CD principles for version control and automated deployments.
* Team Collaboration: Document data workflows and contribute to a shared knowledge base, providing ad\\-hoc support to data analysts and business users.


**Required Skills \\& Experience**
* Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
* Professional Experience: 1\\-3 years of hands\\-on experience in a data engineering or similar role.
* Technical Proficiency:
* Communication \\& Soft Skills:
* Availability: Able to join immediately.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
**About the Role** 




 We are looking for a detail\\-oriented
 **QA Engineer** 
 to ensure the quality, reliability, and performance of our software products. You will work closely with developers, product owners, and project teams to test applications, identify bugs, and improve overall product quality. This role requires strong analytical skills and a passion for delivering flawless user experiences.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents.
* Develop detailed, comprehensive, and well\\-structured test plans and test cases.
* Execute manual test cases for web, mobile, and API testing.
* Identify, document, and track software defects using tools like JIRA.
* Collaborate with developers to troubleshoot issues and verify fixes.
* Perform regression, functional, integration, and system testing.
* Work with automation tools (Selenium, Postman, JMeter, etc.)â€”bonus if experienced.
* Ensure software quality at every stage of development.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes and standards.



  





**Required Skills** 



* Strong understanding of software testing methodologies and SDLC/STLC.
* Experience in manual testing of web or mobile applications.
* Good knowledge of test case design techniques.
* Proficiency with test management and bug tracking tools (JIRA, TestRail).
* Basic experience with API testing tools like Postman or Swagger.
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* Good communication and documentation skills.



  





**Preferred / Nice\\-to\\-Have Skills** 



* Exposure to automation testing (Selenium/WebDriver, TestNG, JUnit).
* Basic knowledge of SQL for database validation.
* Experience with performance testing tools (JMeter).
* Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and version control (Git).
* Knowledge of scripting (Python/Java) for test automation.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, or related field.
* QA certifications (ISTQB) are an added advantage.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description:** 




 We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer with 3\\-5 years of experience to design, develop, and maintain scalable software solutions. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in React, C\\#, microservices, Linux, Kafka, Redis, and CI/CD pipelines. You will collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to deliver high\\-performance, reliable, and secure applications.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain highly scalable microservices using C\\# (.NET Core/.NET 6\\+).
* Build responsive and dynamic user interfaces using React.js with modern state management (Redux, Context API, etc.).
* Work with event\\-driven architectures using Apache Kafka for real\\-time data processing.
* Optimize application performance using Redis for caching and in\\-memory data storage.
* Deploy and manage applications on Linux\\-based environments.
* Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.) for automated testing and deployment.
* Collaborate with DevOps and QA teams to ensure high availability, scalability, and security.
* Troubleshoot and debug complex issues across distributed systems.
* Mentor junior engineers and promote best practices in coding, testing, and architecture.



  





**Required Skills \\& Qualifications:** 



* 3\\-5 years of hands\\-on experience in software development.
* Strong proficiency in C\\# (.NET Core/.NET 6\\+) and React.js.
* Experience with microservices architecture and RESTful/gRPC APIs.
* Familiarity with Apache Kafka (or similar messaging systems).
* Hands\\-on experience with Redis for caching and distributed systems.
* Working knowledge of Linux environments and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Expertise in CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.).
* Strong understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
* Experience with SQL/NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.).
* Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies.



**Preferred Skills:** 



* Experience with TypeScript.
* Knowledge of monitoring tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack)

title: Data Engineer
description:
IMEA (India, Middle East, Africa)
   

  

 India
   

  

 LIXIL INDIA PVT LTD
   

  

 Employee Assignment
   

  

 Fully remote possible
   

  

 Full Time
   

  

 1 May 2025
   

  

**Title**
 Data Engineer
   

  

**Job Description**
 A Data Engineer is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining large\\-scale data systems and infrastructure. Their primary goal is to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and retrieved to support business intelligence, analytics, and data\\-driven decision\\-making.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and Develop Data Pipelines: Create data pipelines to extract data from various sources, transform it into a standardized format, and load it into a centralized data repository.
* Build and Maintain Data Infrastructure: Design, implement, and manage data warehouses, data lakes, and other data storage solutions.
* Ensure Data Quality and Integrity: Develop data validation, cleansing, and normalization processes to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* Collaborate with Data Analysts and Business Process Owners: Work with data analysts and business process owners to understand their data requirements and provide data support for their projects.
* Optimize Data Systems for Performance: Continuously monitor and optimize data systems for performance, scalability, and reliability.
* Develop and Maintain Data Governance Policies: Create and enforce data governance policies to ensure data security, compliance, and regulatory requirements.


**Experience \\& Skills**
* Hands\\-on experience in implementing, supporting, and administering modern cloud\\-based data solutions (Google BigQuery, AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse, Snowflake, etc.).
* Strong programming skills in SQL, Java, and Python.
* Experience in configuring and managing data pipelines using Apache Airflow, Informatica, Talend, SAP BODS or API\\-based extraction.
* Expertise in real\\-time data processing frameworks.
* Strong understanding of Git and CI/CD for automated deployment and version control.
* Experience with Infrastructure\\-as\\-Code tools like Terraform for cloud resource management.
* Good stakeholder management skills to collaborate effectively across teams.
* Solid understanding of SAP ERP data and processes to integrate enterprise data sources.
* Exposure to data visualization and front\\-end tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.).
* Strong command of English with excellent communication skills.

title: Java Full Stack Developer
description:
As a Software Engineer (Java Developer), you will play a key role in delivering high\\-quality, user\\-focused software solutions. You will work within a multidisciplinary development team both in the UK \\& India collaborating closely with software engineers, architects, and business analysts to build and enhance our applications.
   

  

 Responsibilities
   

 \\* Design, develop, and maintain frontend features using Java\\-based technologies and modern UI frameworks.
   

 \\* Collaborate with team members to define requirements.

 \\* Ensure the quality and performance of developed features through code reviews, unit tests.
   

 \\* Work closely with QA engineers to address bugs and ensure the stability and reliability of the product.
   

 \\* Contribute to architectural discussions and help shape technical solutions.
   

 \\* Continuously improve software quality, development processes, and team practices.
   

 \\* Stay up\\-to\\-date with emerging technologies and actively apply best practices.
   

  

 Qualifications
   

 \\* Strong 4\\+ Years experience in Java\\-based fullstack development
   

 \\* Solid understanding of software engineering principles, design patterns, and best practices.
   

 \\* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., CVS)
   

  

 About Infor
   

  

 Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business\\-wide digital transformation.
   

 For more information visit www.infor.com
   

  

 Our Values
   

  

 At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called \\[1] Principle Based Managementâ„¢ (PBMâ„¢) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship \\& compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self\\-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.
   

  

 We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBMâ„¢ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long\\-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
   

  

 Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.
   

  

 At Infor we value your privacy thatâ€™s why we created a policy that you can read \\[2] here.

 Persistent Ltd. is dedicated to fostering diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We invite applications from all qualified individuals, including those with disabilities, and regardless of gender or gender preference. We welcome diverse candidates from all backgrounds.

title: V&V Sr Engineer
description:

 Cubic Transportation Systems
   

  

**Company Details:**
 When you join Cubic, you become part of a company that creates and delivers technology solutions in transportation to make peopleâ€™s lives easier by simplifying their daily journeys, and defense capabilities to help promote mission success and safety for those who serve their nation. **Position Title** 
 : Senior Application Specialist OTC
 **Department** 
 : IT/Digital â€“ OTC
   

  

**Career Path Level:** 
 Senior Reports to: Workstream Leader
   

  

**Position Purpose**
 The Senior Application specialist plays a key role in ensuring the stability, quality, and strategic evolution of IT systems and processes. With significant experience and deep domain knowledge, the Senior Application specialist takes ownership of complex technical or functional areas, mentors less experienced colleagues, and drives solution design and continuous improvement initiatives. This role serves as a bridge between operational execution and architectural thinking, providing leadership within projects and a trusted point of contact for business or technical counterparts.
   

  

**Position Summary:** 
 As a Senior Application specialist, you are a recognized expert in your IT domain. You independently manage and deliver complex initiatives, resolve critical issues, and ensure that solutions align with business needs and IT standards. Your work is both hands\\-on and strategic: balancing delivery with system improvement, business engagement, and peer development. Collaboration across functions, regions, and stakeholder groups is essential to your role.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Take proactive ownership of complex system areas, developments, or processes with minimal supervision within your area of expertise, cross functionally and together with internal and external stakeholders.
* Serve as subject matter expert in your domain; provide advanced support and solution guidance
* Design, implement, and optimize processes or system changes aligned with strategic goals and based on business objectives, user needs, and regulatory requirements.
* Mentor and support junior and mid\\-level colleagues through structured guidance and coaching.
* Actively contribute to project planning, scoping, and design activities; represent IT in business\\-facing discussions.
* Ensure adherence to industry and system standards, documentation, and compliance requirements.


**General Requirements**
* Masterâ€™s degree in System Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field
* Minimum of eight years hands\\-on experience in your field of expertise.
* Proven ability to lead complex initiatives independently, such as large scale projects and drive results.
* Demonstrated leadership in process improvement, problem\\-solving, or technical advancement.
* Strong communication skills in English, both verbal and written; able to clearly convey technical concepts to non\\-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in cross\\-functional and international teams.
* Can support and mentor others and contribute to team development and knowledge sharing. Growth Expectations:


 Senior Application specialists are expected to demonstrate influence beyond their immediate team, consistently deliver high\\-quality outcomes, and take initiative in strategic or cross\\-team programs. Growth from Senior to Solution Architect is marked by a shift from deep expertise to broader architectural vision, proactive business engagement, and a leadership role in shaping future IT solutions.
